header.h2: April 17, 2020 - Information Letter Superintendent Monica Daugherty / Packet Pick Up Day will be Monday, April 27th 11:00am-1:00pm and 5:00-6:00pm / Drive Thru Meal Pickup on Tuesdays at Nevada Joint Union High School 11:30 am -1:00 pm

div.p:
Please read the April 17, 2020 Letter from Superintendent Monica Daugherty.
The next packet pick up day will be Monday, April 27th 11:00am-1:00pm and 5:00-6:00pm
5th grade students can pick up items that were in their classrooms from the front of the school. 7th & 8th grade students if you have items in your hall or P.E. lockers please take them.
See below for the same instructions as last time. Please note that NO ONE should park or get out of the car. This is how it will work: Please Read Carefully. 1. Hang your parent pick-up sign from your rear view mirror. If you do not have a current parent pick up sign, make an 8.5 x 11 Sign with LARGE Letters with your student's name and grade on it. Place it on your dashboard. 2. Packets will be handed out in the parking lot (where buses pick up/drop off). 3. If you have children at multiple schools, please drive through both schools to pick up your individual child’s packets. 4. Staff will meet you at each location and bring out what you need. We are making every effort to ensure that this process goes quickly and smoothly. In the event of a line or backup of vehicles during packet pick-up, your patience is greatly appreciated. At this time, families are to hold onto work and not return it to the school. Teachers will evaluate the work by other means, photo of the work, zoom call with conversations, phone calls to check in and answer questions etc.
We will continue to keep you posted with up to date information as we receive it. Thank you....

Thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate this challenging time.

div.div:
Please read the April 17, 2020 Letter from Superintendent Monica Daugherty. The next packet pick up day will be Monday, April 27th 11:00am-1:00pm and 5:00-6:00pm 5th grade students can pick up items that were in their classrooms from the front of the school. 7th & 8th grade students if you have items in your hall or P.E. lockers please take them. See below for the same instructions as last time. Please note that NO ONE should park or get out of the car. This is how it will work: Please Read Carefully. 1. Hang your parent pick-up sign from your rear view mirror. If you do not have a current parent pick up sign, make an 8.5 x 11 Sign with LARGE Letters with your student's name and grade on it. Place it on your dashboard. 2. Packets will be handed out in the parking lot (where buses pick up/drop off). 3. If you have children at multiple schools, please drive through both schools to pick up your individual child’s packets. 4. Staff will meet you at each location and bring out what you need. We are making every effort to ensure that this process goes quickly and smoothly. In the event of a line or backup of vehicles during packet pick-up, your patience is greatly appreciated. At this time, families are to hold onto work and not return it to the school. Teachers will evaluate the work by other means, photo of the work, zoom call with conversations, phone calls to check in and answer questions etc.
We will continue to keep you posted with up to date information as we receive it. Thank you....

div.div: Nevada City School District prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived ancestry, age, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, nationality, race or ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, parental, family or marital status, or association with a person or a group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. Click here for additional Civil Rights and Board Policy information
